Posts.Content: Hi folks, I'm just over 3yeRs post cancer.. breast cancer her2 positive, 8/12 lymph nodes affected, mastectomy and all grade 3.  I had 6 chemos, 15 radios and 17 herceptins.  The fatigue is horrendous, I am struggling on a daily basis.  When it gets to 14.30 ish I become floored most days.  This post cancer life has left me with arthritis, unable to do the things I love anymore... just wondering if anyone else has the same issues.  All I feel I'm doing is saying the same old things to family and friends, I'm tired, can we have an early night... I'm even getting fed up of hearing myself.... :-/
Posts.Title: 3yrs post cancer... I a man struggling with fatigue and this new life...

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply.   I have had bloods done a while ago and I was vitamin D defficient, I was on supplement and feel much better for it.  I have a demanding job and I have cut my days down.  I was told and I have read that fatigue can continue for years after.  My cancer was her2 positive so a protein cancer not hormonal.  I do not need to take any medication now.  Struggling with the post cancer life.
Posts.Title: 3yrs post cancer... I a man struggling with fatigue and this new life...

Posts.Content: Sounds like we're all in the Docetaxel boat, what a journey!!!! I had my WBC injections for 5 days after my chemo. Nearly 7 days since my last chemo and the last 2 days were grim..  Keep that light at the end of the tunnel in sight, it a hard road but we will get there :)
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: After 3 EC90's and just had my last Docetaxel... blugh...   the hot/sold sweats are rotten, especially in the night. Aching is terrible, but luckily I have good pain management so its got as bad as the first.. phew.  Today is day 3 days post Docetaxel, so im wanning now, need to rest but cant sleep arghhhh.  Self injecting isn't too bad either, but the pain those injections give is grim, for me anyway, ended up swaying side to side in the middle of the night like I needed sectioning under the mental health act it was that bad.  Radio for me next too and Herceptin, I might be something like come Christmas :D   Keep smiling ladies :)
Posts.Title: Docetaxil experiences

Posts.Content: Hello MrsShep... in this forum I think ever women has been fed up, down and yuk, I know for one I have, I've sat and cried, moaned and cried some more.  You will have good days I'm sure :). I called my Macmillan nurse just for a chat when I felt yuk and it does help to have a witter and a moan. Chin up and huge hugs, you are not alone feeling like this x
Posts.Title: Feeling Down

Posts.Content: Hi Noodles, I had this scarf given as a gift, it has greyhounds on it as I am greyhound had :D love the gangly devils to death bless them. I usually buy my scarf from Amazon, some really cheap ones which are good quality.. I have noted that the cotton ones are much better than the silky ones, as the silky ones seem to slink off my head and I wasn't keep... I also have some pashimas, think that's what they are called are they are fab for when its a bit nippier out as they are thicker, also from Amazon and not overly expensive.   Please have a gander on youtube at head scarf ideas, there are lots to see, or you could just make it up as I do.  I had to laugh as a few older ladies have said... ''oo I do like you're hat'' I just nodded and said thanks ...xx
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Hello.... I shaved my hair after my 2nd EC90... it was thinning and more was ending up on my pillow. My hair is growing back now but for the time being 'im wearing head scarfs (see profile photo) my girls said I have more head scarves than clothes hehe.. probably so :).   Having no hair doesn't actually bother me at all :)   Next Tuesday is my last Docetaxel chemo.... bring it on :D
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: *waves* hello Morag...  I have had my mastectomy back in may, I bought new pjs which were front fastening and a front fastening pretty nighty. I didn't find a bra/sports bra comfy for a while but I did buy some night time maternity bras from Mothercare for when I felt able to wear them.  They are very comfy and if you ask an assistant they will guide you to the ones mastectomy ladies buy :) I have also have to inject myself for 5 days after chemo to replenish the WBC, I couldn't be faffed waiting for the nurse to come round, its not that bad really. Only one more chemo next Tuesday then its Radio... Keep strong folks.. we can get through this :D x
